thread.title: NASCAR Announces Base Rules Package for 2016
thread.title_full: NASCAR Announces Base Rules Package for 2016

author: Carmen Cox
title: NASCAR Announces Base Rules Package for 2016
text:
Share Article 
iStock/Thinkstock (DAYTONA BEACH, Fla.) — NASCAR on Wednesday announced the base Sprint Cup Series rules package for the 2016 season, and it highlights the low downforce setup.The base package will include a 3.5-inch spoiler, a 0.25-inch front leading splitter edge and a 33-inch wide radiator pan. As part of the low downforce setup, Goodyear will develop tires to complement it.The setup resembles that of races at Kentucky and Darlington earlier this season.Steve O’Donnell, NASCAR executive vice president and chief racing development officer, said in a statement, "The success of the races at Kentucky and Darlington in similar trim proved extremely valuable in accelerating rules development for 2016. Now, as teams have even more time to prepare and a strong baseline of data, we anticipate the racing to be even better."Copyright © 2015, ABC Radio. All rights reserved. Thursday, October 15, 2015 at 5:30AM
